tit.e: Shinjo Futazuka-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture)
Shinjo Futazuka-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 新庄二塚古墳（しんじょうふたづかこふん）は、奈良県葛城市（旧北葛城郡新庄町）にある古墳で、国の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: Shinjo Futazuka Tumulus is a tumulus in Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture (former Shinjo-cho, Kitakatsuragi County) and is designated as a national historic site.
Shinjo Futazuka-kofun Tumulus is a tumulus in Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture (former Shinjo Town, Kitakatsuragi County) and is designated as a national historic site.
Shinjo Futazuka-kofun Tumulus is a tumulus in Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture (former Shinjo Town, Kitakatsuragi County) and is designated as a national historic site.

sen.j: 1つの古墳で3つの異なった形式の横穴式石室を有するという特徴で知られており、銭取塚とも呼ばれている。
sen.e: It's known for its feature of having three different types of horizontal stone chambers in one tumulus, and is also called Zenitorizuka.
The tumulus is known for its feature of having three different types of horizontal stone chambers in one tumulus, and is also called Zenitorizuka.
The tumulus is known for its feature of having three different types of horizontal stone chambers in one tumulus, and is also called Zenitorizuka.

sen.j: 丘陵の尾根の先端を分断して造られた前方後円墳である。
sen.e: It's a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound, constructed by dividing the tip of the hill ridge.
The tumulus is a large keyhole-shaped mound, constructed by dividing the tip of the hill ridge.
The tumulus is a large keyhole-shaped mound, constructed by dividing the tip of the hill ridge.

sen.j: 葛城山の山麓の標高約200メートルの場所に位置しており、東に大和盆地を一望することができる。
sen.e: It's located at an altitude of 200 meters at the foot of Mt. Katsuragi, and there is a panoramic view of Yamato basin in the east.
It's located at an altitude of about 200 meters at the foot of Mt. Katsuragi, and there is a panoramic view of Yamato Basin in the east.
It's located at an altitude of about 200 meters at the foot of Mt. Katsuragi, and there is a panoramic view of Yamato Basin in the east.

sen.j: 墳丘は二段構築で全長は60メートル。
sen.e: The mound has a double-tiered structure, and its total length is 60 meters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The mound has a two stage structure, and its total length is 60 meters.
The mound has a two stage structure, and its total length is 60 meters.

sen.j: 後円部の直径は36メートルで高さは10メートル、くびれ部西側に造り出し部がある。
sen.e: The rounded part is 36 meters in diameters and 10 meters high, and there is a narrow terrace on the western side of the narrowest part.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The back circular part is 36 meters in diameters and 10 meters high, and there is a narrow terrace on the western side of the narrowest part.
The back circular part is 36 meters in diameters and 10 meters high, and there is a narrow terrace on the western side of the narrowest part.

sen.j: 後方部の高さも10メートル越えており、円墳を二つ繋げたたようなずんぐりとした形となっているが、これは後方部にも石室をつくるために盛り土をしたためである。
sen.e: The height of its posterior part is over 10 meters and since it was mounded to make a rock chamber also in the posterior part, it has a rounded shape like two round barrows were put together.
The height of its back square part is over 10 meters and since it was mounded to make a stone chamber also in the back square part, it has a rounded shape like two round barrows were put together.
sen.cmt: 原文中「後方部」は「前方部」と思われますが、原文通り訳出しています。
sen.e: The height of its back square part is over 10 meters and since it was mounded to make a stone chamber also in the back square part, it has a rounded shape like two round barrows were put together.

sen.j: 明確な周濠は無いが古墳の西は約10メートルほどの幅で平らに整地されており、東側の一段低くなった田も墓域を示す空濠の跡と考えられている。
sen.e: There is no clear surrounding moats, but the west side of the tumulus is leveled nearly 10 meters wide, and the east side of the sunken rice field is considered to be the remain of a dry moat which shows its cemetery area.

There is no clear surrounding moats, but the west side of the tumulus is leveled nearly 10 meters wide, and the east side of the sunken rice field is considered to be the remain of a dry moat which shows the area of the tumulus.

There is no clear surrounding moats, but the west side of the tumulus is leveled nearly 10 meters wide, and the east side of the sunken rice field is considered to be the remain of a dry moat which shows the area of the tumulus.

sen.j: 後円部の横穴式石室は古くから開口しており存在が知られていたが、1958年の発掘調査で後方部と西側の造り出し部分にも横穴式石室があることが判明した。
sen.e: The horizontal stone chamber of the rounded part was opened and known since early time, but by the excavation and research in 1958, it was discovered that there were also horizontal stone chambers in the posterior part and the western narrow terrace.

The horizontal stone chamber of the back circular part was opened and known since early time, but by the excavation and research in 1958, it was discovered that there were also horizontal stone chambers in the back square part and the western narrow terrace.

The horizontal stone chamber of the back circular part was opened and known since early time, but by the excavation and research in 1958, it was discovered that there were also horizontal stone chambers in the back square part and the western narrow terrace.

sen.j: 出土品は奈良国立博物館が収蔵している。
sen.e: Nara National Museum houses the discovered artifacts.
Nara National Museum houses the discovered artifacts.
Nara National Museum houses the discovered artifacts.

sen.j: 出土品などの分析から、築造時期は古墳時代後期の6世紀中ごろとみられている。
sen.e: From the analysis of the artifacts, the time of construction was believed to be around mid-sixth century, the late Kofun period (the period of ancient burial mounds).
From the analysis of the artifacts, the tumulus was believed to be constructed around mid-sixth century, the late Kofun period (tumulus period).
From the analysis of the artifacts, the tumulus was believed to be constructed around mid-sixth century, the late Kofun period (tumulus period).

sen.j: 後円部石室
sen.e: Rock chamber in the rounded part
The stone chamber in the back circular part
The stone chamber in the back circular part

sen.j: 石室は両袖式で全長は16.7メートル。
sen.e: The rock chamber is "ryosode siki" (a style which has stones on both sides of the boundary of a passage and a burial chamber), and the total length is 16.7 meters.
sen.cmt: 両袖式の定訳不明です。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The stone chamber is with ryosode-style (a stone chamber with the passage connected the center of the burial chamber wall), and the total length is 16.7 meters.
The stone chamber is with ryosode-style (a stone chamber with the passage connected the center of the burial chamber wall), and the total length is 16.7 meters.

sen.j: 玄室は長さ6.73メートル幅2.98メートル高さ4.1メートルで、南に開口している。
sen.e: The burial chamber is 6.73 meters long, 2.98 meters wide and 4.1 meters high, and it opens to the south.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The burial chamber is 6.73 meters long, 2.98 meters wide and 4.1 meters high, and it opens to the south.
The burial chamber is 6.73 meters long, 2.98 meters wide and 4.1 meters high, and it opens to the south.

sen.j: 羨道部分には排水溝がつく られている。
sen.e: A drain ditch was made at the passage part.
A drain ditch was made at the passage part.
A drain ditch was made at the passage part.

sen.j: 凝灰岩の石棺が置かれていたとみられているが、すでに破壊されており詳細は不明である。
sen.e: It was believed to have housed a stone coffin made of tuff, but had already been destroyed so the detail is unclear.
It is believed to have housed a stone coffin made of tuff, but had already been destroyed so the detail is unclear.
It is believed to have housed a stone coffin made of tuff, but had already been destroyed so the detail is unclear.

sen.j: 古くから開口していたが、発掘調査で金銅花形座金具、馬具、鉄製武器、農耕 具、玉類が出土している。
sen.e: It was opened since early times, and from excavation and research, gilt bronze parts of flower-shaped seats, harnesses, iron arms, farming tools, and beads were found.
sen.cmt: 金銅花形座金具の定訳不明です。
sen.e: It was opened since early times, and from excavation and research, gilt bronze parts of flower-shaped seats, harnesses, iron arms, farming tools, and beads were found.
It was opened since early times, and from excavation and research, gilt bronze parts of flower-shaped seats, harnesses, iron arms, farming tools, and beads were found.

sen.j: 前方部石室
sen.e: Rock chamber in the front part
The stone chamber in the front square part
The stone chamber in the front square part

sen.j: 石室は片袖式で全長は9メートル。
sen.e: The rock chamber is "katasode siki" (a style which has a stone on one side of the boundary of a passage and a burial chamber), and the total length is 9 meters.
sen.cmt: 片袖式の定訳不明です。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The stone chamber is katasode-style (stone chamber with the passage connected the side in the burial chamber wall), and the total length is 9 meters.
The stone chamber is katasode-style (stone chamber with the passage connected the side in the burial chamber wall), and the total length is 9 meters.

sen.j: 玄室は長さ3.9メートル幅1.7メートル高さ1.9メートルで、凝灰岩でつくられた組合せ式石棺の底の部分のみが残っている。
sen.e: The burial chamber is 3.9 meters long, 1.7 meters wide and 1.9 meters high, and only the bottom of the combined style stone coffin made of tuff is left.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The burial chamber is 3.9 meters long, 1.7 meters wide and 1.9 meters high, and only the bottom of the combined style stone coffin made of tuff remains.
The burial chamber is 3.9 meters long, 1.7 meters wide and 1.9 meters high, and only the bottom of the combined style stone coffin made of tuff remains.

sen.j: 馬具、農耕具、金・銀製中空玉が出土している。
sen.e: Harnesses, farming tools, and beads with a hole in the middle which were made of gold and silver were found.
sen.cmt: 金・銀製中空玉の定訳不明です。
sen.e: Harnesses, farming tools, and hollow center beads made of gold and silver were found.
Harnesses, farming tools, and hollow center beads made of gold and silver were found.

sen.j: 造り出し部石室
sen.e: Rock chamber in the narrow terrace
The stone chamber in the narrow terrace
The stone chamber in the narrow terrace

sen.j: 造り出し部の石室は朝鮮半島の一部で見られる特殊な形式である。
sen.e: The rock chamber at the narrow terrace has a characteristic style which is seen in some part of Korean Peninsula.
The stone chamber at the narrow terrace has a characteristic style which is seen in some part of Korean Peninsula.
The stone chamber at the narrow terrace has a characteristic style which is seen in some part of Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 石室は無袖式で全長は7.82メートル。
sen.e: The rock chamber is "musode siki" (a style which has no stones on the boundary of a passage and a burial chamber), and the total length is 7.82 meters.
sen.cmt: 無袖式の定訳不明です。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The stone chamber is musode-style (a stone chamber which passage is connected indistinguishably from the burial chamber) and the total length is 7.82 meters.
The stone chamber is musode-style (a stone chamber which passage is connected indistinguishably from the burial chamber) and the total length is 7.82 meters.

sen.j: 玄室は長さ4.48メートル幅1.35メートル高さ1.26メートルである。
sen.e: The burial chamber is 4.48 meters long, 1.35 meters wide and 1.26 meters high.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The burial chamber is 4.48 meters long, 1.35 meters wide and 1.26 meters high.
The burial chamber is 4.48 meters long, 1.35 meters wide and 1.26 meters high.

sen.j: 玄室が羨道部分より一段低く（0.9メートル）つくられているという、特異な形式である。
sen.e: The burial chamber was made lower (0.9 meters) than the passage, and this makes it unique.
The burial chamber was made lower (0.9 meters) than the passage, and this makes it unique.
The burial chamber was made lower (0.9 meters) than the passage, and this makes it unique.

sen.j: 発掘調査の結果、琥珀製棗玉、鉄製武器、農耕具のほか須恵器と土師器が多数が出土している。
sen.e: From the result of the excavation and research, natsumedama (jujube- shaped bead) made of amber, iron arms, and farming tools were found as well as sueki (unglazed ware) and Haji pottery.
From the result of the excavation and research, natsumedama (jujube- shaped bead) made of amber, iron arms, and farming tools were found as well as sueki (unglazed ware) and Haji pottery.
From the result of the excavation and research, natsumedama (jujube- shaped bead) made of amber, iron arms, and farming tools were found as well as sueki (unglazed ware) and Haji pottery.

sen.j: 盗掘を受けていなかったため、これらの総数118個にもおよぶ副葬品が石室内に所狭しと並べられた状態で発見され、そのため副葬品埋葬のための石室ではないかとの説も出された。
sen.e: Not having been robbed, a total of 118 burial goods were found crammed in the rock chambers, and this led a theory that it was a rock chamber for burial goods.
Not having been robbed, a total of 118 burial goods were found crammed in the stone chambers and this led a theory that it was a stone chamber for burial goods.
Not having been robbed, a total of 118 burial goods were found crammed in the stone chambers and this led a theory that it was a stone chamber for burial goods.

sen.j: しかし、遺品の間に2メートルあまりの空間があることから、ここに木棺が安置されていたと考えられている。
sen.e: However, there was two meters long space in between the burial goods, and a wooden coffin was considered to be placed.
However, there was two meters long space in between the burial goods, and a wooden coffin was considered to be placed.
However, there was two meters long space in between the burial goods, and a wooden coffin was considered to be placed.

sen.j: 葛城市歴史博物館 - 出土品の一部、墳丘模型のジオラマが展示されている。
sen.e: The Museum, History of Katsuragi – some of the artifacts, and a diorama of the tumulus are shown.
The Museum, History of Katsuragi: Some of the artifacts and a diorama of the tumulus are shown.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: The Museum, History of Katsuragi: Some of the artifacts and a diorama of the tumulus are shown.

sen.j: 屋敷山古墳（国史跡）
sen.e: Yashikiyama Tumulus (national historical site)
